answer: It takes about two weeks after vaccination for antibodies to develop in the body that protect against influenza (flu) viruses. In B.C., clinics will likely have the influenza (flu) vaccine by late October or early November. Some pharmacies and clinics may have it earlier. You can contact your local health unit or pharmacy to find out when the vaccine will be available in your area. You can also use our influenza (flu) clinic locator to find a clinic near you.

question: Today is Friday; I am leaving for Asia Sun morning - should I try to get a flu shot before I leave or wait till I return?
